item.title: Every Destiny 2 The Edge of Fate Weapon Revealed So Far
item.description:
As part of the exciting new changes and content coming to Destiny 2 , a few upcoming weapons have already been revealed, notably, a returning Exotic from the original Destiny , and two new legendary weapons. Based on what’s been shown off about these new weapons, Destiny 2 ’s The Edge of Fate expansion is already shaping up to be quite a game-changer for the endgame meta in both PvE and PvP.

Throughout the recent teasers and reveal trailers, there have been several additional weapons seen in passing, though only a few of the new weapons coming to Destiny 2 were shown off in detail. Ultimately, players will surely see more upcoming weapons revealed in future trailers and get a chance to use some of these weapons firsthand when The Edge of Fate expansion releases on July 15.

Every Exotic and Legendary Weapon from Destiny 2’s The Edge of Fate Expansion Revealed So Far

New Land Beyond

The New Land Beyond is an ironsight sniper rifle that is a spin on a returning Exotic weapon from the original Destiny , the No Land Beyond. Unlike its predecessor, the New Land Beyond has the benefit of utilizing Destiny 2 ’s airborne-accuracy stats, and its damage buff now lasts until the player dies.

Weapon Perks:

  • Horizon Ironsights: Sturdy ironsights. Increases range. Slightly increases handling speed.
  • Accurized Rounds: This weapon can fire over longer distances. Increases range.
  • Snapshot Sights: Faster time to aim down sights.
  • Short-Action Stock: This weapon is incredibly easy to grip. Greatly increases handling speed.

Exotic Weapon Perk:

  • Bullseye Bolster: Landing a precision hit substantially increases this weapon’s target acquisition, handling, reload speed, and stability for a short duration of time.

Exotic Weapon Intrinsic Trait:

  • THE MASTER: Scoring precision hits increases this weapon’s damage until the wielder’s defeat. Massively increases ammo reserves.

According to Redditor u/DrSector’s post on r/DestinyTheGame, THE MASTER buff can reach 100 stacks, and the name of the buff will change at certain thresholds.

As of May 6, players who pre-order the Year of Prophecy Ultimate Edition for Destiny 2 can immediately unlock the New Land Beyond Exotic . The Year of Prophecy Ultimate Edition includes both The Edge of Fate and Renegade expansions for Destiny 2 , and, in addition to the New Land Beyond Exotic, purchasing this edition will immediately unlock a variety of new armor ornaments inspired by famous Star Wars characters, an Exotic Ghost shell, an emblem, and an emote.

Giver’s Blessing

While very few weapons have been shown off in detail so far, the Giver’s Blessing, a Kinetic, rapid-fire frame auto rifle that was revealed, has some major implications for other upcoming weapons. More specifically, the version of this weapon that was shown off was a tier-5 weapon, with its random weapon attachments and Origin perk capable of being enhanced, while also having three random perks available in both columns. Considering that this is seemingly just a common weapon from the loot pool of Destiny 2 ’s new planet, Kepler, the endgame weapons from The Edge of Fate expansion will surely shake up the meta for legendary weapons in major ways.

Yeartide Apex

This new lightweight frame Solar SMG will be part of the Solstice 2025 Seasonal Event loot pool. Weapons from this Seasonal Event are said to be the first to utilize Destiny 2 ’s newest Holofoil cosmetic theme, which is a moving design on the weapon that depicts an ocean shoreline. Though the full perk rolls of this weapon are still unknown, the version of this weapon shown off in the stream notably featured the Heal-Clip perk in its first column, and a new, unknown perk in its second column. The Yeartide Apex SMG also has the choice of two Origin perks: Tex Balanced Stock or Dream Work.

item.title: Stardew Valley: What Is The Quarry For?
item.description:
Since mining is one of the main ways to harvest natural resources in Stardew Valley , players will likely find themselves doing a lot of pickaxe-swinging. While breaking rocks and boulders on one's farm can be a convenient way to gather stone-borne goods, it's often more efficient to seek out spots where rarer gems have a better chance to spawn.

Out of all the locations in Stardew Valley , the Quarry is one of the best places to do some mining , as it offers the greatest surface area with rocks, boulders, and other nodes to harvest. However, it will take some work to unlock, so players will need to perform a few tasks before being able to mine the Quarry for its goods.

Updated on May 7, 2025 by Renri Seong : Stardew Valley players who want to level up their mining skills without diving into the mines should visit the Quarry. The Quarry is a region in Stardew Valley that won't be readily available in your first year. There are two ways to unlock the Quarry depending on what you choose to do with Pelican Town's Community Center. Regardless of your methods, the Quarry houses ore, stone, and even gems that can be useful if you're in the early-mid stages of your playthrough. The following guide has been revamped to include Quarry-related information in Stardew Valley 's 1.6 version.

How To Unlock The Quarry

Community Center vs. Joja Mart

To get to the Quarry, you'll need to repair the bridge on the east side of the Mountains area, near the Adventurer's Guild. The bridge can be repaired through the Community Center Bundles or the Joja Community Development Form .

If you want the Quarry as soon as possible, then you're better off going the Joja route, since the Community Center will take longer. However, the Community Center route gives you rewards for completing each bundle, which can be helpful on a first playthrough.

How To Complete The Craft Room Bundles

To get the Quarry through the Community Center, you'll need to complete all the bundles for the Crafts Room . This is the room where you obtain the golden scroll for the "Rat Problem" quest. Craft Room bundles require foraging items such as Winter Root, Red Mushroom, and Stone. Here's what you'll need to complete the Crafts Room:

No. of Slots

Required/Acceptable Materials

Completion Reward

Spring Foraging Bundle

4

  • Wild Horseradish (forage in Spring)
  • Daffodil (forage in Spring)
  • Leek (forage in Spring)
  • Dandelion (forage in Spring)

x30 Spring Seeds

Summer Foraging Bundle

3

  • Grape (forage in Spring, grow crop in Fall)
  • Spice Berry (forage in Summer)
  • Sweet Pea (forage in Summer)

x30 Summer Seeds

Fall Foraging Bundle

4

  • Common Mushroom (forage in Fall, Secret Woods, or Farm Cave (mushroom option))
  • Wild Plum (forage in Fall, Farm Cave (fruit bat option))
  • Hazelnut (forage in Fall)
  • Blackberry (forage in Fall, Farm Cave (fruit bat option))

x30 Fall Seeds

Winter Foraging Bundle

4

  • Winter Root (till soil or Artifact Spots in winter, defeat Blue Slimes on floors 41-79 in Mines)
  • Crystal Fruit (forage in Winter, drop from Dust Sprites on floors 41-79)
  • Snow Yam (till soil or Artifact Spots in winter)
  • Crocus (forage in Winter)

x30 Winter Seeds

Construction Bundle

4

  • x99 Wood (chop trees with Axe)
  • x99 Wood (chop trees with Axe)
  • x99 Stone (break stones with Pickaxe)
  • x10 Hardwood (chop large stumps or large logs with Steel Axe)

x1 Charcoal Kiln

Exotic Foraging Bundle

5

  • Coconut (forage in the Desert)
  • Cactus Fruit (froage in the Desert)
  • Cave Carrot (break boxes or till soil in the Mines)
  • Red Mushroom (Mushroom Floors in the Mines, forage in the Secret Woods during summer or fall, the Farm Cave (mushroom option))
  • Purple Mushroom (Mushroom Floors in the Mines, the Farm Cave (mushroom option))
  • Maple Syrup (collect from tapper on a Maple Tree)
  • Oak Resin (collect from tapper on an Oak Tree)
  • Pine Resin (collect from tapper on a Pine Tree)
  • Morel (forage in Secret Woods during the spring, the Farm Cave (mushroom option))

x5 Autumn's Bounty

How To Buy The Bridge From The Joja Community Development Form

If you paid for a Joja Membership at JojaMart for 5000g, then the Community Center will be replaced with the Joja Warehouse. To complete the restoration projects, you'll need to speak to Morris in JojaMart and pay for any of the five repairs through the Joja Community Development Form . Unlike bundles, you're not restricted by season-exclusive resources, so you can choose what to repair in any order you like... if you have the funds.

To restore the bridge to the Quarry, you'll need to pay 25000g . This is the third-cheapest option on the development form. However, you can potentially have the bridge fixed before winter, which you wouldn't be able to do if you went the Community Center route.

Where to Find the Quarry

Every Spawn in the Quarry

If you look on the map, the Quarry is in the northeast corner (refer to the red circle in the above image). As mentioned earlier, you can get to the Quarry by heading east from the Adventurer's Guild outside the Mines in the Mountains (north of Pelican Town).

Rocks, gem deposits, ore deposits, and trees spawn in the Quarry. To get the most out of the Quarry, you should mine every rock and cut down every tree so that new resources can spawn the following day. Since the Quarry is isolated from Pelican Town and doesn't receive any visitors, you can place machines such as the Mayonnaise Machine if you need more room. Try to place it around the edges so it doesn't interfere with Quarry's respawns.

  • The most common spawn in the Quarry are rocks , which give you Stone when broken. Some of these rocks may also drop Coal .
  • Coal Nodes were added in 1.6 and have the same spawn rate as the Copper Nodes.
  • Copper, Iron, and Gold Nodes are rarer than rocks, but more common than Gem Nodes.
  • Gem Nodes all have 0.2% spawn rates.
  • There's a very rare chance you'll see a Mystic Stone or an Iridium Node . The Mystic Stone has a 0.18% chance of spawning, and can drop Iridium Ore or Prismatic Shards . Iridium Nodes have a 0.01% chance of spawning. If you don't have Skull Cavern or the Statue of Perfection, then the Quarry will be your most-reliable way of farming Iridium Ore.

You might also find Artifact Spots , Seed Spots, and oak/maple tree sprouts in the Quarry. You should clear these wtih the hoe and axe respectively to make room for more spawns.

The Quarry Mines 1.6 (Golden Scythe)

North of the Quarry bridge is a cave that leads to the Quarry Mines. Unlike the regular mines, the floor layout isn't randomized. As of 1.6, there's a new path you can take in the Quarry Mine to reach the end. The only monsters that appear in the Quarry Mine are skeleton mages, skeleton (dangerous), Haunted Skulls, and copper/iron Slimes.

If you manage to make it to the end of the Quarry Mine, you'll find a statue of the Grim Reaper holding a Golden Scythe. Take it from the statue, then interact with the statue again to be warped back to the Quarry Mine's entrance.

item.title: Call of Duty: Warzone Temporarily Disables Ranked Play
item.description:
Summary

  • Ranked Play has been temporarily disabled in Call of Duty: Warzone due to Skill Rating issues not being properly awarded in the mode.
  • Raven Software is also investigating server disconnect issues in Call of Duty: Warzone.
  • The playlist will also be updated to reflect Ranked Play being disabled.

Ranked Play has been temporarily disabled in Call of Duty: Warzone as the developers investigate ongoing issues affecting the mode over the course of Season 3 Reloaded. Although Season 3 Reloaded brought several content additions to Call of Duty: Warzone , the update was accompanied by various issues affecting the game's servers.

Each season of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 and Warzone offers a slew of new content, including major Reloaded updates that mark the halfway point of the season. In Call of Duty: Warzone , the Season 3 Reloaded update continued to evolve the Verdansk map with new features and improvements. For example, the Verdansk Train Station opened with multiple access points, and Rebirth Island's Triumph TF 250-X motorbike was added to Verdansk with the new update. Season 3 Reloaded also introduced High Value Loot Zones and more contracts, including the Big Game Bounty Contract and Train Recon Contract. However, Call of Duty: Warzone's Ranked Play mode didn't benefit from the update, due to issues involving Skill Rating.

The official Call of Duty Updates Twitter account posted an update on the status of Ranked Play in Call of Duty: Warzone , confirming that it will be temporarily disabled while investigations into server disconnects and crashes are ongoing. According to the developers from Raven Software, there's been a rise in players not being properly awarded Skill Rating in Ranked Play matches. The playlist will be updated to reflect Ranked Play being disabled for the time being, and the developers intend on working toward restoring the Ranked Play experience back to its intended form.

Raven Software Disables Call of Duty: Warzone Ranked Play Due to Skill Rating Not Being Awarded as Intended

The community's response to the update has been mostly negative, with many players citing their frustrations with Ranked Play and server disconnects in the past week. Some Call of Duty: Warzone players are disappointed with the game since network issues have been a constant issue in Ranked Play following the release of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 . As a result, some players aren't optimistic about Ranked Play and would like the developers to focus on other issues affecting Call of Duty: Warzone's modes, including problems with cross-play settings on consoles.

A timeframe for when players can expect Ranked Play to return has not been given, but Call of Duty: Warzone players still have new content and events to enjoy in Season 3 Reloaded, including the 4/20-themed Blaze of Glory event. During the event, Call of Duty: Warzone players can earn Blaze Bucks from loot caches and supply crates. Players have until May 15 to earn cosmetic rewards from the Blaze of Glory event in Call of Duty: Warzone before the next event begins.

item.title: How To Unlock Frost Blast in Black Ops 6 Zombies (& Best Augments)
item.description:
Season 3 Reloaded is packed full of content for Black Ops 6 , introducing additional battlegrounds like Signal and a revamped version of Nuketown, along with the highly anticipated Ladra Submachine Gun, letting players go gung-ho with an iconic Black Ops SMG in style. But that’s not all.

While Season 3 Reloaded offers content across all game modes, Zombies also receives exclusive additions, including the debut of Shattered Veil: Directed Mode and the Zombie Snacks LTM. However, the highlight is undoubtedly the return of Frost Blast, allowing players to freeze waves of undead enemies. Here’s how to unlock Frost Blast in Black Ops 6 and the best Augments to use with it.

How To Unlock Frost Blast In Black Ops 6 Zombies

To unlock Frost Blast in Black Ops 6 Zombies, players will need to acquire Blaze Bucks to redeem it via the Blaze of Glory Event page during the event's limited runtime. Blaze Bucks are a special item that drops through eliminations in either Multiplayer or Zombies, or via opening supply caches in Warzone .

Players will need a total of 20 Blaze Bucks collected , which they can use to claim the seventh mystery prize for the event to get the Frost Blast Zombies Field Upgrade. Once done, it can be equipped as their active Field Upgrade for their Zombies loadout.

The Blaze of Glory Event ends on May 15 at 10 AM PT. When it does, the Frost Blast Field Upgrade will become an Armory Unlock for those who do not already have it.

How Does Frost Blast Work in Black Ops 6 Zombies?

The Frost Blast Field Upgrade functions just like its counterpart last seen in Black Ops Cold War Zombies, serving as an excellent area-of-effect ability that handles crowds of zombies fairly easily. When activated, Frost Blast creates a small blizzard in the area it is deployed , dealing lethal damage upon activation, then slowing enemies that enter its area of effect while inflicting tick damage.

The duration of the area of effect for the base version of Frost Blast with no Augments is six seconds, which is fairly brief. Frost Blast excels at dealing with large groups of zombies, but it can also be effective at slowing down Special and Elite enemies like Doppelghasts and Elder Disciples, making it easier to land critical hits on them.

Best Frost Blast Augments In Black Ops 6 Zombies

When it comes to the best Augments to use with Frost Blast, the choices are fairly clear. By far the best Major Augment is Flash Freeze, which allows Frost Blast to completely freeze regular zombies and instantly kill them when they take any damage. This makes Frost Blast incredibly effective at clearing out standard enemies almost instantly.

For the Minor Augment, two notable options stand out. For a more damage-focused build, choose Frost Bite, which increases the damage dealt to frozen enemies. This setup is ideal for dealing heavy damage to Special and Elite enemies caught within Frost Blast’s radius. Extension is another solid pick, as it significantly increases the duration for which Frost Blast remains active.

item.title: What to Expect From Street Fighter 6's Elena
item.description:
Summary

  • Street Fighter 6 Years 1-2 Fighters Edition, including Elena, launches on June 5 for multiple platforms.
  • Elena, known for her capoeira skills, gets a new design and players can unlock her classic outfit.
  • A major balance patch for Street Fighter 6 will release alongside Elena's debut, adjusting characters and game systems.

During the Nintendo Switch 2 Direct, Capcom announced that it was working on an upgraded port of Street Fighter 6 for Nintendo's upcoming console. This version of the game, titled Street Fighter 6 Years 1-2 Fighters Edition , will launch alongside the Switch 2 on June 5, and it will also be available on other platforms, like PlayStation, Xbox, and PC. The Years 1-2 Fighters Edition will contain all the paid stage and character DLCs that were released in the first two years of Street Fighter 6 's post-launch support. The final upcoming character in the game's Year 2 roadmap, Elena, will be included and released on the same day as this edition, as well.

To newcomers to the Street Fighter franchise, Elena's name may not ring any bells, but those who have stuck around with the series since the late 90s may have an idea of who she is. Elena is a playable character in the Street Fighter universe who was introduced in the 1997 arcade game Street Fighter 3: New Generation . She was one of the first black characters to ever be conceived for a fighting game, and she was created by the famous Capcom game designer Akira "Akiman" Yasuda. Elena has appeared in various types of Street Fighter media over the years, and her latest iteration in Street Fighter 6 retains a lot of the charm of her original character design.

Elena is Finally Making Her Way to Street Fighter 6

Elena is a Nature-Loving African Princess Who's Skilled At Capoeira

Elena, for those who are unaware, is a princess of an East African nation who was born to a tribal leader in Kenya named Jafari. According to Street Fighter 's lore, she aims to travel the world and attend school internationally in order to become a veterinarian and make some friends. Elena is very fond of nature and music, and she is a master of the Afro-Brazilian martial art known as capoeira. Like the real-world sport that it's based on, Elena's combat style is an unusual cross between fighting and dancing, and she primarily uses her legs to attack in the games that she appears in.

If Players Don't Like Elena's New Look, They Can Unlock Her Old Outfit Instead

Most of the returning characters in Street Fighter 6 have received major new redesigns, and Elena will be no different. Capcom has confirmed that Elena will have a completely new look that "emphasizes both her grace and physique," according to the company. At launch, she will be available in two different outfits; the first one will be her default look and the second one will be modeled after her attire in Street Fighter 3: New Generation . In order to obtain Elena's second outfit, players will have to max out their bond with her in Street Fighter 6 's World Tour mode or purchase it individually by using Fighter Coins.

Alongside Elena's release, Capcom will add a brand-new, Africa-themed stage to Street Fighter 6 called Reniala Remains.

A Patch Will Be Released for Street Fighter 6 on the Same Day that Elena Comes Out

On the same day that Elena is released as part of the Street Fighter 6 Years 1-2 Fighters Edition , Capcom plans to launch a major balance patch for the game on all platforms. This patch will make some adjustments to the 25 characters that are currently present in Street Fighter 6 , and it will include some new tweaks that'll influence the systems in the game, as well.

Although Capcom hasn't provided in-depth information about what this patch exactly contains, it has revealed that Elena will be available to the owners of Street Fighter 6 's Year 2 Character Pass and Year 2 Ultimate Pass at no extra cost, in addition to those who purchase Street Fighter 6 Years 1-2 Fighters Edition . Those who buy either of these two DLCs will also unlock Mai Shiranui, Terry Bogard, and M. Bison as playable characters in Street Fighter 6 , alongside some drive tickets and custom character outfits.

Play legendary masters and new fan favorites like Ryu, Chun-Li, Luke, Jamie, Kimberly and more in this latest edition with each character featuring striking new redesigns and exhilarating cinematic specials.
Dominate the Fighting Ground: Street Fighter 6 offers a highly evolved combat system with three control types - Classic, Modern and Dynamic - allowing you to quickly play to your skill level.

The new Real Time Commentary Feature adds all the hype of a competitive match as well as easy-to-understand explanations about your gameplay. The Drive Gauge is a new system to manage your resources. Use it wisely in order to claim victory.

Explore the Streets in World Tour: Discover the meaning of strength in World Tour, an immersive, single-player story mode. Take your avatar and explore Metro City and beyond. Meet Masters who will take you under their wing and teach you their style and techniques.

Seek Rivals in the Battle Hub: The Battle Hub represents a core mode of Street Fighter 6 where players can gather and communicate, and become stronger together. Use the avatar you create in World Tour to check out cabinets on the Battle Hub floor and play against other players, or head over to the Game Center to enjoy some of Capcom's classic arcade games.
